summary: This bill, the Protecting Small Business Competitions Act of 2025, aims to amend the Small Business Act. It focuses on codifying the "Rule of Two," mandating that contracts, task orders, and delivery orders exceeding a certain value be reserved for small businesses if the contracting officer anticipates receiving offers from two or more responsible small businesses and can award the contract at a fair market price. The bill seeks to support small businesses by promoting competition in government contracting.
